title: Ali Hassan al-Majid
summary: Ali Hassan Abd al-Majid al-Tikriti (Arabic: علي حسن عبد المجيد التكريت‎, romanized: ʿAlī Ḥasan ʿAbd al-Majīd al-Tikrītī; 30 November 1941 – 25 January 2010), nicknamed Chemical Ali (Arabic: علي الكيمياوي‎, romanized: ʿAlī al-Kīmīawī),[2] was an Iraqi politician and military commander under Saddam Hussein who served as Defence Minister, Interior Minister, and chief of the Iraqi Intelligence Service. He was also the governor of Kuwait during much of the 1990–91 Gulf War.
